bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Miriam Bogorad Gittelson was apparently a Communist activist in the 1930s and 1940s and prossibly a writer of political ballads and songs, perhaps under the pseudonym Lida Auville.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This small, unprocessed collection contains published and unpublished song books, sheet music and scores, and a folder containing a compilation, aparently by the American Youth Congress, of lyrics and a few sheets of music. A number of the items in this folder are antiwar songs, apparently from the period of the Soviet-German Nonagression Pact, 1939-1941. Almost all the scores are without attribution; some appear to be original works, while others are arrangements or transcriptions of published songs. There is a folder of unpublished sheet music by either or both Ray and Lida Auville (the latter may be a pseudonym for Gittelson). There are numerous published songbooks and sheet music for individual songs, including a folder of songs by "Lewis Alan" (Abel Meeropol); these are in box three. Also included are an International Workers Order membership certificate for Lester Lazarus Gittelson (presumably M.B. Gittelson's husband), and the text of "The Jewish Cultural Clubs and Societies in These Challenging Times," a radio talk by Sam Pevzner, broadcast on WBAI (New York City), 1969, and (in box two) two undated photographs of Howard Fast, speaking from the podium at a public event with a portion of a banner in Yiddish seen in the background .
